bibliographic-data.invention-title: ADVERTISEMENT CAMPAIGN SYSTEM USING SOCIALLY COLLABORATIVE FILTERING

nplcit.text: Takahashi et al.,: The Active Lurker: Influence of an In-house Online Community on its Outside Environment, November 2003, ACM, Group '03, Florida, pages 1-10
Nonnecke et al.: Lurker demographics: Counting the silent, April 1-6, 2000, CHI 2000, The Hague, Amsterdam, CHI Letters, Vol. 2, Issue 1, pages 73-80
Ridings et al.: Psychological Barriers: Lurker and POster Motivation and Behavior in Online Communities, Communications of Association for Online Communities, 2006, volume 18, pages 329-354

abstract.p: In one embodiment, a method comprises identifying, in a network, user selection preferences of an identified user having accessed the network, the identifying based on an accumulation of user selection inputs executed by the identified user, the user selection inputs accumulated relative to input options presented to the user and identifying respective available network items

classifying, by an apparatus in the network, the identified user into one of multiple user affinity categories relative to an advertisement campaign for a targeted product, the classifying based on determining whether one of the user selection inputs represents a view gesture of the user having viewed the targeted product
and selecting an advertisement asset for delivery to the identified user based on the classifying of the identified user into the one user affinity category.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: ADVERTISEMENT CAMPAIGN SYSTEM USING SOCIALLY COLLABORATIVE FILTERING

abstract.p: In one embodiment, a method comprises identifying, in a network, user selection preferences of an identified user having accessed the network, the identifying based on an accumulation of user selection inputs executed by the identified user, the user selection inputs accumulated relative to input options presented to the user and identifying respective available network items

classifying, by an apparatus in the network, the identified user into one of multiple user affinity categories relative to an advertisement campaign for a targeted product, the classifying based on determining whether one of the user selection inputs represents a view gesture of the user having viewed the targeted product
and selecting an advertisement asset for delivery to the identified user based on the classifying of the identified user into the one user affinity category.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: ADVERTISEMENT CAMPAIGN SYSTEM USING SOCIALLY COLLABORATIVE FILTERING
SYSTÈME DE CAMPAGNE PUBLICITAIRE UTILISANT UN FILTRAGE SOCIALEMENT COOPÉRATIF

abstract.p: In one embodiment, a method comprises identifying, in a network, user selection preferences of an identified user having accessed the network, the identifying based on an accumulation of user selection inputs executed by the identified user, the user selection inputs accumulated relative to input options presented to the user and identifying respective available network items

classifying, by an apparatus in the network, the identified user into one of multiple user affinity categories relative to an advertisement campaign for a targeted product, the classifying based on determining whether one of the user selection inputs represents a view gesture of the user having viewed the targeted product
and selecting an advertisement asset for delivery to the identified user based on the classifying of the identified user into the one user affinity category.

Dans un mode de réalisation de l'invention, un procédé comprend l'identification, dans un réseau, des préférences de sélection d'utilisateur d'un utilisateur identifié ayant accédé au réseau, l'identification étant basée sur un cumul des entrées de sélection d'utilisateur exécutées par l'utilisateur identifié, les entrées de sélection d'utilisateur étant cumulées par rapport à des options d'entrée présentées à l'utilisateur et identifiant des éléments de réseau disponibles respectifs

le classement, par un appareil dans le réseau, de l'utilisateur identifié dans une des multiples catégories d'affinité d'utilisateur par rapport à une campagne publicitaire pour un produit ciblé, le classement étant basé sur la détermination du fait qu'une des entrées de sélection d'utilisateur représente un geste de visualisation de l'utilisateur ayant vu le produit ciblé
et la sélection d'un bien publicitaire pour une livraison à l'utilisateur identifié en fonction du classement de l'utilisateur identifié dans la catégorie d'affinité d'utilisateur.
